articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians have waited for two days at roadblocks.
articles.title: Hamas to release Israeli hostage Yehud, two others before Friday, Israel to allow Gazans to return home north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwandan-backed rebels marched into the centre of east Congo's largest city, witnesses said, in the latest escalation of decades of conflict in a region already suffering one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.
articles.title: Congo rebels reach centre of eastern city in major escalation

articles.author: Oliver Griffin, Luis Jaime Acosta, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Colombia's President Gustavo Petro averted an economic disaster at the 11th hour after diplomats from his government and the U.S. reached a deal on deportation flights, but the Colombian business community on Monday called for cooler heads to prevail as Colombians bemoaned canceled U.S. visa appointments.
articles.title: Colombia avoids trade war with US as business community, citizens call for cooler heads

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko extended his 31-year rule with a massive win in a presidential election that Western governments have rejected as a sham, according to preliminary results on Monday.
articles.title: Lukashenko pockets massive win in Belarus election scorned by the West

articles.author: Barbara Erling, Kuba Stezycki
articles.description: Auschwitz survivors will be joined by world leaders on Monday to mark the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi German death camp by Soviet troops, in what will likely be one of the last such gatherings of those who experienced its horrors.
articles.title: Auschwitz survivors to mark 80th anniversary of camp's liberation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Monday that the rigours of nearly three years of war did not allow for changes in mobilisation rules because if soldiers left for home en masse, Russian President Vladimir Putin "will kill us all".
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says war means mobilisation rules cannot be changed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinian refugees in Israeli-occupied East Jerusalem were set to lose education, healthcare and other services provided by U.N. agency UNRWA as an Israeli ban on the organisation takes effect on Thursday.
articles.title: UN agency for Palestinians readies to shutter operations in East Jerusalem after Israeli ban

articles.author: Nate Raymond, Mike Scarcella
articles.description: A transgender woman serving in a federal prison has filed a lawsuit arguing that President Donald Trump's executive order directing the U.S. government to recognize only two, unchangeable sexes and requiring inmates like her to be housed in men's prisons violates the U.S. Constitution and federal law.
articles.title: Transgender inmate sues over Trump's order curtailing LGBT rights

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: The New Zealand government said it is reviewing its development aid programme with the Pacific nation of Kiribati after the country's president cancelled a meeting with New Zealand’s foreign minister earlier in January.
articles.title: New Zealand reviews Kiribati aid programme after presidential snub

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: A new school textbook that likens Russia's war in Ukraine to the Soviet struggle against the Nazis and says Russia was "forced" to send troops into Ukraine was presented in Moscow on Monday.
articles.title: Russia issues school textbook saying it was 'forced' to march into Ukraine
